isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Lubrication and Maintenance - Lubrication

note.para: Use only SAE Grade 50W oil, Meritor specification O-81, in the transfer case.

svcprocinfo.para: For complete lubrication information for Meritor's transfer cases, refer to Maintenance Manual 1, Lubrication. To obtain a copy of this publication, call Arvin Meritor's Customer Service Center at 800-535-5560 or check the web at arvinmeritor.com/tech_library/home.asp

svcsubproc.title: Lubricant Temperatures

caution.para: Meritor transfer cases may operate above 190°F (88°C) without damage. However, if the oil temperature reaches 250°F (121°C), stop the vehicle immediately. Check for the cause of overheating. Maximum continuous oil temperature must not exceed 225°F (107°C). Damage to components can result.

svcsubproc.para: The transfer case oil sump should have a maximum continuous operating temperature of 225°F (107°C) and an absolute maximum temperature of 250°F (121°C).

item.para: If the vehicle temperature reaches 250°F (121°C): Stop the vehicle immediately. Check for the cause of overheating.

If the transfer case continuous sump temperature is over 225°F (107°C) caused by high input speeds with high ambient temperatures and poor air circulation:
Use a lighter viscosity oil recommended by Meritor. Also use a lighter viscosity oil in extremely cold climates.

svcsubproc.title: Multi-Viscosity Oils
svcsubproc.para: Meritor does not approve multi-viscosity motor oils. Refer to Maintenance Manual 1, Lubrication, for a list of approved oils.
Meritor does approve petroleum-base and synthetic-base oils.

svcsubproc.title: Do Not Install API GL-5 Oils

caution.para: Only use oil specified by Meritor in a transfer case. Do not install API GL-5 oils, which contain extreme pressure (EP) additives. These additives can form sludge at normal operating temperatures. Damage to components will result.

svcsubproc.para: Do not install API GL-5 oils in a transfer case. This specification contains extreme pressure (EP) additives that can form sludge at normal operating temperatures and damage transfer case components.

svcsubproc.title: Petroleum-Base and Synthetic-Base Oils

caution.para: Do not mix or switch petroleum-base synthetic-base oils in a transfer case. Damage to components will result. Only install the same oil type that was originally specified throughout the life of the transfer case.

svcsubproc.para: Meritor approves both petroleum-base and synthetic-base oils. However, do not mix or switch these oils in a transfer case. Damage to components will result. Use the same oil type that was originally specified in the transfer case.

Synthetic oils must be approved by Meritor's engineering department. Refer to publication TP-90114 for a list of approved distributors. To obtain this publication, call Arvin Meritor's Customer Service Center at 800-535-5560 or check the web at arvinmeritor.com/tech_library/home.asp
